sen.j: 『明月記』（めいげつき）は、鎌倉時代の公家藤原定家の日記。
sen.e: Meigetsuki (The Record of the Clear Moon) is the Kamakura period diary of FUJIWARA no Sadaie, who is more commonly known as "Teika."
Meigetsuki (The Record of the Clear Moon) is the Kamakura period diary of FUJIWARA no Sadaie, who is more commonly known as "Teika."
"Meigetsuki" (The Record of the Clear Moon) is the Kamakura period diary of FUJIWARA no Sadaie, who is more commonly known as "Teika."

sen.j: 定家が治承4年(1180年) から嘉禎元年（1235年）までの56年間にわたり克明に記録した日記である。
sen.e: In this diary, Teika conscientiously recorded the events of a 56-year span, from Jisho 4 (1180) to Katei 1 (1235).
In this diary, Teika conscientiously recorded events over a span of 56 years, from Jisho 4 (1180) to Katei 1 (1235).
sen.cmt: I think "over a span of 56 years" reads a bit more naturally here.
sen.e: In this diary, Teika conscientiously recorded events over a span of 56 years, from 1180 to 1235.

sen.j: 日記としての価値以上に、歴史書・科学的記録としても価値がある。
sen.e: Above and beyond its value as a diary, it is also valuable as a historical and scientific record of this period.
Aside from its value as a diary, it is also valuable as a historical and scientific record of this period.
sen.cmt: "Above and beyond" to a more natural sounding "aside".
sen.e: Aside from its value as a diary, it is also valuable as a historical and scientific record of this period.

sen.j: ただし、漢文で記されていて難解な部分が多い。
sen.e: But since it was written in the difficult classical Chinese hybrid script known as kambun, many portions of it remain unintelligible.
But since it was written in the difficult classical Chinese hybrid script known as kambun, many portions of it remain unintelligible.
But since it was written in the difficult classical Chinese hybrid script known as kanbun, many portions of it remain unintelligible.

sen.j: また、定家自身の体験に基づいていない記録も含まれる。
sen.e: Moreover, the diary includes some entries that are not based on Teika's personal experience.
Moreover, the diary includes some entries that are not based on Teika's personal experience.
Moreover, the diary includes some entries that are not based on Teika's personal experience.

sen.j: 例えば、1054年のかに星雲の超新星爆発は、定家誕生以前の出来事であるが伝え聞いた内容として以下のように記載されている。
sen.e: For example, Teika has an entry on the 1054 supernova explosion in the Crab Nebula, despite the fact that this happened before he was born; in the supernova entry, he repeats hearsay like the following.
For example, Teika has an entry on the 1054 supernova explosion in the Crab Nebula, despite the fact that this happened before he was born, meaning the entry was made as pure hearsay.
sen.cmt: I wasn't really sure what to make of " in the supernova entry, he repeats hearsay like the following", since there are no further examples, so I changed it to "meaning the entry was made as pure hearsay".
sen.e: For example, Teika has an entry on the 1054 supernova explosion in the Crab Nebula, despite the fact that this happened before he was born, meaning the entry was made as pure hearsay.

sen.j: 日記の主な部分は冷泉家時雨亭文庫に残り、芸林荘・東京国立博物館・京都国立博物館・天理図書館にもある。
sen.e: Today, most portions of the diary remain in the Shigure-tei bunko (storehouse) library of the Reizei family (Teika's descendants), but some are part of other private literary collections, while others are held at the Tokyo National Museum, the Kyoto National Museum, and the Tenri library.

Today, most portions of the diary remain in the Shigure-tei bunko (storehouse) library of the Reizei family (Teika's descendants), but some are part of other private literary collections, while others are held at the Tokyo National Museum, the Kyoto National Museum, and the Tenri library.

sen.j: また和歌および書道の上での定家への異常な尊崇から広く分散し、掛け軸などとして諸家に分散しているものも少なくない。
sen.e: Furthermore, in terms of Teika's waka poems and calligraphy, there is a strangely strong reverence for his work, so they have spread widely, and examples of his work mounted as hanging scrolls (kakejiku) and so forth and distributed to a wide range of different families are far from rare.

Furthermore, in terms of Teika's waka poems and calligraphy, there is a strangely strong reverence for his work, so they have spread widely, so it is not uncommon to see examples of his work mounted as hanging scrolls (kakejiku) and so forth and distributed to a wide range of different families.
sen.cmt: I felt "not uncommon" read a little more naturally than "far from rare" here, and I also moved it to earlier in the sentence to read a little smoother.
sen.e: Furthermore, in terms of Teika's waka poems and calligraphy, there is a strangely strong reverence for his work, so they have spread widely, so it is not uncommon to see examples of his work mounted as hanging scrolls (kakejiku) and so forth and distributed to a wide range of different families.

sen.j: 一部分が国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: One portion of his work was designated a National Treasure.
One portion of his work was designated a National Treasure.
One portion of his work was designated a National Treasure.

sen.j: 冷泉家時雨亭文庫に残る原本は掛け軸等にするため切り取られている部分が多いため、研究などには一般には原本に近いとされる徳大寺家本が使用されている。
sen.e: Because many sections of the manuscript that remains in the Shigure-tei storehouse of the Reizei family, in order to be made into hanging scrolls and the like, were cut apart, the copy held by the Tokudaiji family, which is considered close to the original, is usually used for the purposes of research and so forth.

sen.cmt: "remains" - "remain". Also, "Were cut apart in order to be made" reads more naturally here.
